content.description: Climbed this with 2 others and we each did it a different way, so the rating is for my path. Crux was going straight up over the slight "overhang". Sub 5'9" might have a hard time reaching above to jam in the crack. My two partners went right just under the overhang and around a "block" to the huecos, which looked difficult and awkward in it's own way. Looked like some decent placements for trad, however, the rock was crumbly where you would want pro for the crux, so I would recommend TR first and scout it out yourself.
content.protection: 3 bolts for the anchor - 1 hanger spins, 1 is not flush with the rock, and 1 looks bomber.
content.location: Just R of "Bad Influence". Stay between the arete on bad influence and L of the "block/fin" mentioned above. Either go straight up and then traverse right, or traverse right under the overhang and around the block/fin. Bolts are above the ladder on top of the rock which you cannot see from the ground. Set up TR just like all other routes.

content.description: This a fun little roof route on the east side of Shady rock. It is hard to reach the first bolt for shorter climbers, hence the name, due to bad feet early on and a necessary reach over the edge. Crux is turning from the overhang to the face.
content.protection: Two bolts. Bolted anchor with screw links on top. Watch the tree if you swing out of the cave. Can be toproped but really watch out for the swing then.
content.location: Start in front of the cave with first bolt right above you.

content.description: Fun route, just left of Slot Nose.  It's a bit easier than the 5.10a rating, probably 5.9.  Ascend using a nice, chalk-crusted hand crack.  On toprope, it is tempting to go left, but the route stays right; just follow the bolts.  The crux comes just below the anchor, where you ascend a "slot" similar to Slot Nose's.
content.protection: Two bolts on route.  Shares the same two-bolt anchor with Slot Nose.

content.description: Climb the face past large huecos to a distinct crux just before the anchors, can be mossy or have leaf litter at the top.
content.protection: Two quickdraws and an anchor, the first draw is fairly high but climbing to it is easy.
content.location: the leftmost route on the west face of Shady Rock

content.description:
This is the rightmost route on the west side of Shady Rock.  Bruce Morris's guidebook has a good topo.  Crux is just below the first bolt; a fairly tricky mantle.  Climb left from the first bolt, up 5.4 rock, then ascend the eponymous "slot" just below the anchor.  An arm-bar may be useful here.

Variation

: From the first bolt, climb left and ascend the obvious arete to the anchor.  Probably goes about 5.9.  It's tricky to clip the bolt when leading this variation.
content.protection:
Two bolts on route, two-bolt anchor.  Warning: one bolt has a rappel ring.  Nobody likes to rap from one bolt -- can someone put some new hardware up there?  I equalized the rig with a biner, but someone took it.

Protection update: There are two rappel rings, not one. (4/24/2016)

content.description: Start as far left of Small Man Complex as you can, and traverse all the way around to the right of Herpes Simplex. The hardest moves are moving around the corner between Slot Nose and Cotton Mouth. So much fun!

This is a fun short bouldery climb, with the real climbing down low, moving underneath and over the roof. The crux is at the second bolt, either right before or right after clipping, depending on your beta.
content.location: Starts just to the right of Tall Man Simplex, at the right end of the huge roof. Traverse left under the roof to a bolt near some pockets.

content.description: This route is next to "Special Effects" on Shady Rock's west face.  Enjoy 20 feet of 5.6 hand work in trademark Castle Rock caves and flakes. The first bolt is quite high. The second is just below a cave which is  under the prominent bulge which crosses the entire rock. There are numerous opportunities to place medium cams or slot medium-to-large nuts on the way up. The crux is just below the anchor. Try to lieback a right-facing corner, and have faith as you reach up for high hands. They're not quite "thank god" pockets, but they're a helluva lot better than nothing. This route would definitely be rated 5.9 at many other areas.
content.protection: Two bolts on route, two bolt anchor.  First bolt is about 15' up; you can tie off a runner to buckethandles down low.

content.description: Fun little climb, easy to hit if you're spending some time on shady rock. Getting to the first bolt is the crux be aware.
content.protection: 2 bolts leading to a 2 bolt anchor. Watch out for the right anchor bolt, it's sketch. If you're gonna top rope it, set up your rope through a draw on the first bolt or you might go for a swing
content.location: Start just left of tall man simplex,  edge of the cave up to the first bolt. Up and right to the second and then to a shared anchor with tall man simplex, herpes simplex, and bad influence.

content.description: Pull the overhang and then work the arete, eventually going left toward the 3rd bolt (shared with the simplexes)
content.location: Farthest bolted route to the Right on the cave side of shady rock
